author: Phil Lewis
title: Introducing Empowa
description: A severe housing backlog in Africa (50 million units) & lack of property wealth, compounded by financial exclusion & growing urbanisation

assessments.note: This is an ambitious project to eventually fund the building of housing in Africa through the issue of NTF's which earn returns based on rent generated by those houses. However the current proposal is purely to build one house, with further development requiring smart contracts on the Cardano blockchain. Perhaps this proposal should wait for a later round?

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Grow Africa, Grow Cardano initiative. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to get a home in Africa. The problem and solution in the proposal are well stated and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will transform the lives of many people in the African marketplace who are seeking to build a home or rent a sustainable property.

This proposal addresses the need to allow affordable housing to the community in Africa, by leveraging smart contracts in Cardano ecosystem to provide the financing aspect for them through investors using tokenomics approach.
The current proposal is just to build a house to prove up the builders design. It seems likely the proponents could deliver on this.

Based on the information given in this project proposal, it is highly likely for this proposal to be implemented because the team has done extensive research intending to solve this real estate problem in Africa. The team member seems to have extensive experience in technology and the real estate industry. This understanding of technology is an edge for the project to be built quickly on top of the Cardano blockchain. The budget per unit is feasible, and I would recommend the team present architectural designs this way, the community will know what type of home can be built. The Tokenizations of Empowa is relevant in helping the project raise more money once the platform is developed.

The Empowa team consists of four members, with expertises in different area that are close to how the community works in Africa, as well as their plan partnership with Casa Real as well as WADA will definitely improve their chance of success. A more detailed plan can be found in their whitepaper => https://drive.google.com/file/d/1a6jfh2srNLXvNp0GSLyFAc-51DGBY6Br/view

The current plan to build one house is feasible. Future plans which actually integrate with Cardano Smart Contracts are not detailed. Thus they are hard know if they are feasible. They may require future funding. The question that must be answered is should Catalyst be funding the building of a prototype house. It seems the next phase it what should interest catalyst, and it should not be hard to find a builder who has already built houses that could be used.
assessments.reply: This reviewer has assessed us based on our future plans "Future plans which actually integrate with Cardano Smart Contracts are not detailed. Thus they are hard know if they are feasible" which is unrelated to our Catalyst proposal.

assessments.note: The information in the roadmap and milestones is sufficient and can be audit against the project progress. The only question is: Does the Empowa project already started? I am asking this question because the roadmap state that the project began in Q1 January 2021 and that token pre-sale has occurred. Is this correct? Otherwise, the proposed project provides clear KPI's and milestones.

The team defined a concept called Empowerment scores that will be incorporated in the NFT cards to include a history around the property and empowerment it represents, such
as stories, images and video, the completion of the property's construction, tenant stories, community projects.

solution: Empowa will be a unique decentralised property funding platform, empowering global communities to elevate living conditions & create wealth
experience: Founders have complementary experience implementing creative on-the-ground African property developments & large scale software platforms
